snippet: Quebec on Tuesday released a plan to ban government workers from wearing religious symbols. Critics called the move xenophobic.
abstract: Quebec’s separatist government releases plan to ban government workers from wearing 'overt and conspicuous' religious symbols; charter generated widespread controversy when it was leaked to Montreal newspaper earlier in summer, but Quebec lawmakers have defended it as way to maintain secular and cohesive society.
lead_paragraph: Quebec on Tuesday released a plan to ban government workers from wearing religious symbols. Critics called the move xenophobic.

headline.main: Quebec Calls for Ban on Wearing Symbols of Faith
headline.print_headline: Quebec Calls for Ban on Wearing Symbols of Faith
